newsitem.title: BELGIUM: TAX HARMONISATION NEEDED UNDER EMU - LAMFALUSSY.
newsitem.headline: TAX HARMONISATION NEEDED UNDER EMU - LAMFALUSSY.

text.p: Indirect tax policies among countries joining a single European currency will more than likely be harmonised, Alexandre Lamfalussy, president of the European Monetary Institute, said on Wednesday.
"I think it would be very difficult to operate a monetary union without very strong coordination of indirect taxation," Lamfalussy told a monetary sub-committee of the European Parliament.
Regarding direct taxation, Lamfalussy said it was conceivable that differences among particpating governments could be maintained.
"You may get a sort of natural competition between countries (on direct taxation), but this is not coordination," he added.
